oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Decatur G. Chapin, a white officer of the 55th United States Colored Troops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter is from Decatur G. Chapin, a white officer of the 55th USCT. Chapin was originally a private with the 12th Ill. Inf. Regt., and by mid-1864 is serving a dual role with the Tennessee Freedmen, Enrolled Militia, a home guard militia organized by the state. He writes of being "detailed on General Court Marshal" and has strong opinions of General Forrest's presence in West Tenn., specifically at Fort Pillow and in the city of Memphis.
